str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Judea, a Roman province, capital Jerusalem. Feminine of Ioudaios; the Judaean land, a region of Palestine.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.
And, even, also, namely.
Of Hebrew origin; Samaria, a city and region of Palestine.

str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.

str2: From the same as oikodome; to be a house-builder, i.e. Construct or confirm.

str2: To increase, multiply. From another form of plethos; to increase.

str2: To travel, journey, go, die.

Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
